etymologies: late Middle English: probably a blend of the synonymous dialect words scrat and cratch, both of uncertain origin; compare with Middle Low German kratsen and Old High German krazzōn

definitions: score or mark the surface of (something) with a sharp or pointed object

examples.text: the car's paintwork was battered and scratched
he scratched at a stain on his jacket

shortDefinitions: score or mark surface of something with sharp or pointed object

definitions: make a long, narrow superficial wound in the skin of

examples.text: her arms were scratched by the thorns
I scratched myself on the tree

shortDefinitions: make long, narrow superficial wound in skin of

definitions: rub (a part of one's body) with one's fingernails to relieve itching

examples.text: Jessica lifted her sunglasses and scratched her nose

shortDefinitions: rub part of one's body with one's fingernails to relieve itching

definitions: make (a mark or hole) by scoring a surface with a sharp or pointed object

examples.text: I found two names scratched on one of the windowpanes

shortDefinitions: make mark or hole by scoring surface with sharp or pointed object

definitions: write (something) hurriedly or awkwardly

examples.text: pass me my writing things—I'll scratch a few letters before I get up

shortDefinitions: write something hurriedly or awkwardly

definitions: remove (something) from something else by pulling a sharp implement over it

examples.text: he scratched away the plaster

shortDefinitions: remove something from something else by pulling sharp implement over it

definitions: make a rasping or grating noise by scraping something over a hard surface

examples.text: the dog scratched to be let in

shortDefinitions: make rasping or grating noise by scraping something over hard surface

definitions: (of a bird or mammal, especially a chicken) rake the ground with the beak or claws in search of food

examples.text: the hens cannot do anything that comes naturally to them, such as scratch around

shortDefinitions: of bird or mammal rake ground with beak or claws in search of food

definitions: accomplish (something) with great effort or difficulty

examples.text: he scratches out a living growing strawberries

shortDefinitions: accomplish something with great effort or difficulty

definitions: cancel or strike out (writing) with a pen or pencil

examples.text: the name of Dr. McNab was scratched out and that of Dr. Daniels substituted

shortDefinitions: cancel or strike out writing with pen or pencil

definitions: withdraw (a competitor) from a competition

examples.text: Oswald's Zephyr was the second horse to be scratched from a race today

shortDefinitions: withdraw competitor from competition

definitions: (of a competitor) withdraw from a competition

examples.text: due to a knee injury she was forced to scratch from the race

shortDefinitions: (of competitor) withdraw from competition

definitions: cancel or abandon (an undertaking or project)

examples.text: the original filming schedule has been scratched

shortDefinitions: cancel or abandon

definitions: play a record using the scratch technique.

examples.text: he raps and scratches simultaneously to dazzling effect

shortDefinitions: play record using scratch technique

phrases.text: you scratch my back and I'll scratch yours

definitions: a mark or wound made by scratching

examples.text: the scratches on her arm were throbbing
scratch marks on the door

shortDefinitions: mark or wound made by scratching

definitions: a slight or insignificant wound or injury

examples.text: it's nothing—just a scratch

shortDefinitions: slight or insignificant wound or injury

definitions: an act or spell of scratching oneself to relieve itching

examples.text: he gave his scalp a good scratch

shortDefinitions: act or spell of scratching oneself to relieve itching

definitions: a rasping or grating noise produced by something rubbing against a hard surface

examples.text: the scratch of a match lighting a cigarette

shortDefinitions: rasping or grating noise produced by something rubbing against hard surface

definitions: a rough hiss, caused by the friction of the stylus in the groove, heard when a record is played.
shortDefinitions: rough hiss, caused by friction of stylus in groove

definitions: a technique, used especially in rap music, of stopping a record by hand and moving it back and forth to give a rhythmic scratching effect

examples.text: a scratch mix

shortDefinitions: technique

definitions: the starting point in a handicap for a competitor receiving no odds
etymologies: originally denoting a boundary or starting line for sports competitors

examples.text: a 631-meters handicap, when the excellent stayer, Too Fast, will be off scratch

shortDefinitions: (in sport) starting point in race for competitor that is not given handicap or advantage

definitions: a handicap of zero, indicating that a player is good enough to achieve par on a course

examples.text: he plays off scratch in University golf

shortDefinitions: handicap of zero, indicating that player is good enough to achieve par on course

definitions: money

examples.text: he was working to get some scratch together

shortDefinitions: money

phrases.text: you scratch my back and I'll scratch yours

definitions: assembled or made from whatever is available, and so unlikely to be of the highest quality

examples.text: at least two vessels set sail with scratch crews

shortDefinitions: assembled or made from whatever is available, and so unlikely to be of highest quality

definitions: (of a sports competitor or event) with no handicap given

examples.text: he was a scratch player at many courses

shortDefinitions: (of sports competitor or event) with no handicap given

phrases.text: you scratch my back and I'll scratch yours
